data.value: WARNING: Use of -force no longer has any effect.

data.name: ERROR_BOOT_WIM
data.value: Failed to boot specified WIM. Please ensure the device supports this operation.

data.name: STATUS_ERROR
data.value: Status : ERROR - Please refer below for more details

data.name: ERROR_NO_PLATFORM_ID
data.value: No platform ID override info cleared.

data.name: USAGE
data.value:
Usage: FFUTool -flash <path to FFU file to apply to disk> [path to flashing WIM] FFUTool -uefiflash <path to FFU, flashed from UEFI directly> FFUTool -fastflash <path to FFU, flashed from UEFI directly> FFUTool -wim <path to WIM to boot from RAM> FFUTool -skip FFUTool -list FFUTool -massStorage FFUTool -clearId FFUTool -serial FFUTool -setBootMode <boot mode> <optional profile name> FFUTool -getServicingLogs <output path> FFUTool -getFlashingLogs <output path> FFUTool -noLog
flash and fastflash use the FastFlash protocol, if the client supports it, to improve bandwidth. uefiflash uses the traditional flash protocol
noLog is an optional parameter to not generate the log files that FFUTool generates by default; it may be used with any other parameters.

data.name: ERROR_AT_LEAST_ONE_DEVICE_FAILED
data.value: At least one of the devices failed to execute the operation.

data.name: ERROR_WIM_BOOT
data.value: WIM boot failed. Please reset your device and use "ffutool -uefiFlash" to flash your image.

data.name: ERROR_RESET_MASS_STORAGE_MODE
data.value: Failed to reset to mass storage mode.

data.name: ERROR_MORE_THAN_ONE_DEVICE
data.value: One connected device is expected in order to flash, {0} found.

data.name: RESET_MASS_STORAGE_MODE
data.value: Success, device resetting to mass storage mode.
